titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Kings County lien law 1986.034
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:19:58 +0000.

did.abstract: A booklet containing a Kings County lien law passed on June 8, 1853. The law permitted building contractors to place a lien on the owner's building an/or materials or land on which the contractors worked.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Kings County lien law, 1986.034, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1986.
